bug.short_desc: [compiler][null] Switching on @Nullable enum value does not trigger "Potential null pointer access" warning

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 228586 Code that reproduces the bug
Using a @Nullable enum value in a switch statement does not trigger the "Potential null pointer access" warning that it should, potentially leading to runtime NullPointerExceptions. The warning appears correctly when switching on a @Nullable String or Integer object (the latter, presumably, because of the auto-unboxing operation).
I've attached example code that, for me, shows an error when trying to switch on a @Nullable String value, but does not show errors when switching on @Nullable enum values.
Confirmed present in Kepler.
Shankha, do you want to work on this in sequel to bug 411771?
Started Working.

Created attachment 240050 WIP: Patch
I will have to run tests and see if the results are green. If possible please have a look at org.eclipse.jdt.core/compiler/org/eclipse/jdt/internal/compiler/ast/SwitchStatement.java
and let me know if the changes look good.

Created attachment 240052 Patch
All test results are green.

Created attachment 240053 Patch
Changed a few comments inside the test case (as part of the original test case) which could be misleading.
Thanks

The patch is good, essentially. Please just fix these
(1) split the test case in two so that the main part can be executed also below 1.7 (2) remove duplicate copyright header (just add IBM Corp. as a contributor) (3) remove unused variable in test case (4) adjust expected error to new file name and line numbers (5) extra bonus for: indenting the complex boolean expression so that nesting structure is better visible :)

Created attachment 240226 Patch : Changes Incorported for Comment 7
(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #7) > (1) split the test case in two so that the main part can be executed also > below 1.7 Instead of test case I have spit the error messages as per compliance level. Hope you are fine with it.
> (2) remove duplicate copyright header (just add IBM Corp. as a contributor) Done. Removed the header and added IBM to list of contributors. I haven't added the defect ID to contributor list as it is not there for other files.
> (3) remove unused variable in test case Removed the variable err1.
> (4) adjust expected error to new file name and line numbers Changed.
> (5) extra bonus for: indenting the complex boolean expression so that > nesting structure is better visible :)
I have made the changes.
Thanks

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #8) > Created attachment 240226 [details] > Patch : Changes Incorported for Comment 7 > > (In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #7) > > (1) split the test case in two so that the main part can be executed also > > below 1.7 > Instead of test case I have spit the error messages as per compliance level. > Hope you are fine with it.
No, that's not OK, because the error against the switch-on-string causes us to skip analyseCode at 1.6- which means the main test is *NOT* performed at these levels. Ergo: the unrelated error re switch-on-string confuses both developer and compiler. Please split into separate tests as requested before.
While making adjustments, please also expect the correct error message for 1.8

Created attachment 242335 Patch: Changes Incorporated in Comment 9 (Test Changes)
The patch is different from the previous patch with respect to only test cases.
(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #9) > Please split into separate tests as requested before. I Have split the test case. The string test is separated from enum test case.
> While making adjustments, please also expect the correct error message for > 1.8
The error message has been split for 1.8 in testBug403674a.
Request to review.
Thanks.

Created attachment 242340 Patch: Changes Incorporated in Comment 9 (Test Changes)
Sorry. The previous patch had a extra variable. Copying the Comment 10 so that everything is at one place.
---Patch---
The patch is different from the previous reviewed patch with respect to only test cases.
(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #9) > Please split into separate tests as requested before. I Have split the test case. The string test is separated from enum test case.
> While making adjustments, please also expect the correct error message for > 1.8
The error message has been split for 1.8 in testBug403674a.
Request to review.
-----
Please also have a look at Comment 11.
Thanks.

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #11) > // Error > (1) For 1.8 the error message is: > Potential null pointer access: this expression has a '@Nullable' type > (2) For 1.7 the error message is: > Potential null pointer access: The variable value may be null at this > location > > Isn't the error message in 1.7 better that 1.8 ?
Why do you say better?
What will a user look for, when facing one of the messages?
(1) Look at the type of the receiver, oh yes, that's @Nullable, sorry, I'll fix that.
(2) Search the incoming data flows, which might be a *lot* more complex than shown in the example: "where might this supposed null come from? Hm, I don't see any null. Maybe compiler is wrong?"
Your turn: why do *you* think the user will be happier with *(2)*?

(In reply to Stephan Herrmann from comment #13) > (2) Search the incoming data flows, which might be a *lot* more complex than > shown in the example: "where might this supposed null come from? Hm, I don't > see any null. Maybe compiler is wrong?" > > Your turn: why do *you* think the user will be happier with *(2)*?
The user gets a hint that the value may be null so let us put a NULL check around it. That may not be the correct fix though. The underlying cause may be somewhere else.

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #14) > The user gets a hint that the value may be null so let us put a NULL check > around it. That may not be the correct fix though. The underlying cause may > be somewhere else.
With *nullable* message also he gets same hint. Okay, the message now being emitted is better.

(In reply to shankha banerjee from comment #12) > Created attachment 242340 [details] > Patch: Changes Incorporated in Comment 9 (Test Changes) > ... > > Request to review.
Patch is good, thanks Shankha.
I only applied some polish (white space, comments) to the test case.
To be released after the next batch of testing.

Hi Stephan, I am sorry. Both the test cases testBug403674 and testBug403674a should not have the same comment. It was a copy paste mistake. The second comment does not make sense.
Thanks, Shankha
Test and fix released for 4.4 M7 via http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=40188f33c95cacc4bba783f2dcf5939576fd2791
Verified for 4.4 M7 using I20140429-2000 build
